    Retrieve Imagery

    arc_raster.Rd

    Given an ImageServer export an image as a SpatRaster from the terra package. See terra::rast.

    Usage

    arc_raster(
  x,
  xmin,
  xmax,
  ymin,
  ymax,
  bbox_crs = NULL,
  crs = sf::st_crs(x),
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL,
  format = "tiff",
  token = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_TOKEN")
)

    Arguments

    x

    an ImageServer as created with image_server().

    xmin

    the minimum bounding longitude value.

    xmax

    the maximum bounding longitude value.

    ymin

    that minimum bounding latitude value.

    ymax

    the maximum bounding latitude value.

    bbox_crs

    the CRS of the values passed to xmin, xmax, ymin, and ymax. If not specified, uses the the CRS of x.

    crs

    the CRS of the resultant raster image and the provided bounding box defined by xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax (passed outSR query parameter).

    width

    default NULL. Cannot exceed x[["maxImageWidth"]].

    height

    default NULL. Cannot exceed x[["maxImageHeight"]].

    format

    default "tiff". Must be one of "jpgpng", "png", "png8", "png24", "jpg", "bmp", "gif", "tiff", "png32", "bip", "bsq", "lerc".

    token

    authorization token fetched from the environment variable ARCGIS_TOKEN

    Value

    An object of class SpatRaster.

    Details

    Examples

    if (interactive()) {
img_url <- "https://landsat2.arcgis.com/arcgis/rest/services/Landsat/MS/ImageServer"

landsat <- arc_open(img_url)

arc_raster(
  landsat,
  xmin = -71,
  ymin = 43,
  xmax = -67,
  ymax = 47.5,
  bbox_crs = 4326,
  width = 100,
  height = 100
)
}
